Tuesday, May 29, 2007























'Dr. Death' to leave prison
Dr. Jack Kevorkian, also known as Dr. Death, is to be released from prison on Friday. The man who once dropped off bodies at hospital emergency rooms and dared authorities to stop him now says he won't break any laws or counsel anyone about assisted suicide once he's out of prison. 
FULL STORY


























NANCY GRACE Airs on Headline PRIME, 8 p.m. ET
"Nancy Grace" is television's only justice-themed interview and debate show. Nancy Grace challenges guests
on the most controversial and high-profile legal issues of the day by drawing on her unique perspective
as a former violent crimes prosecutor and as a crime victim herself.  Send your questions and comments.





















Famed forensics expert takes a hit
Twelve years ago, the O.J. Simspon trial made forensic scientist Henry Lee famous. Now, at the same Los Angeles courthouse, the Phil Spector trial could hurt his reputation.
FULL STORY






Lethal injection takes 10 tries
Death penalty opponents called on the state to halt executions after prison staff struggled to find suitable veins on a condemned man's arm to deliver the lethal chemicals.
FULL STORY






Fake firefighter guilty of sex attack
The case of a man who impersonated a firefighter to attack and sexually abuse a fashion writer in her home came down to whether a jury believed he was too mentally ill to be held responsible.
FULL STORY






Jury: Family killed for inheritance
Shawn Bentler, who was unemployed, - trembled as he was found guilty of killing his parents and three teenage sisters in what prosecutors said was a plot to get hsi hands on an inheritance.
FULL STORY
